history.content:
Hello everyone!!

 

The Bioengineering Honor Society is hosting its 8th annual BioEHSC™, the nation’s largest Bioengineering High School Competition! We’re looking for students like you who are willing to mentor teams from all backgrounds. As a mentor, you will be guiding a high school team in designing a biological or medical engineering project, which they will present in a final research symposium on April 10th. You can use this opportunity to help students by incorporating your EE/CS interest with biological/medical applications.

 

Mentors should commit 1-3 hours of work per week to support their team, and will be monitoring the team’s progress and answering their questions, not doing the brunt of the project. Plus, it looks great on Med/grad apps, NSF, and other grant apps!

 

We encourage all majors and years to apply. If you’re interested, please complete this registration form (bit.ly/2021MentorRegistration) by this Sunday, February 14th, 11:59PM. We hope you will take advantage of this rewarding opportunity to inspire the next generation of scientists and engineers!

For detailed information on the competition, visit bioehs.berkeley.edu/bioehsc, or email us at bioehsc@bioehs.berkeley.edu.
